channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2024010239
item.description:
Report E-2024010239

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: TROY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 9, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon box of UN1824 fell in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the impacted site. MEG personnel deployed granular absorbents, neutralizer and absorbent pads to the sodium hydroxide solution-impacted trailer interior and impacted pallets. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024010116
item.description:
Report E-2024010116

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-04
  • City: BUFFALO
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BUFFALO & PITTSBURGH RAILROAD, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FRA HM Inspector Steven Myers found HM tank car PROX 47160 placarded class3, UN 3295, loaded with UN3295 Hydrocarbons, Liquid, N.O.S. class 3, PG 1, (natural gasoline) to be venting at the vacuum relief device. This was reported to BPRR management and SPSI was dispatched by Buffalo & Pittsburgh Railroad (Rita Mager) to investigate and make certified permanent repairs. Shipper MarkWest Energy, Shawn Dunkle notified. Upon inspection, SPSI determined defective vacuum relief device and they did not have part, so made temporary repairs (gasket) to eliminate any venting possibility. Shipper notified car owner, Gunvor, who hired Rescar to make repairs.

item.title: Report X-2024010252
item.description:
Report X-2024010252

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-17T15:11:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-21
  • City: SCHENECTADY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: unload manager brought package to qa and left it in the damage area during the preload sort DescribePack: Package contained 2 1-Gallon cans and 3 Quarter-Gallon plastic bottles. 1 Gallon can leaked, causing product to spill on to all other contents. Outer box could fit 4 1-Gallon cans, but contained above. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: manager brought it to qa and morning qa repacked it into a salvage drum

item.title: Report E-2024010115
item.description:
Report E-2024010115

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-08
  • City: BALDWINSVILLE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When attempting to load freight into trailer, forklift operator went to pick up the pallet the freight was staged on and the forkblades on the forklift were too high as they entered the pallet consequently puncturing a jerrican staged on the pallet contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on one of the bottles were loose and during transportation one of the inner gallon bottles leaked out on the package. DescribePack: The cap on the bottle was not tightly closed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Following directional arrows

Report E-2024010113

  • State: NY

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approx 30 Gallons of NALBRITE 62513 is leaking from a 330 gallon tote due to a forklift puncture and is leaking on the trailer floor. No Drains, Soils or Water ways have been affected.
